title: Two Fed Officials Say March Rate Rise Justified by Inflation
sub_head: Charles Evans and James Bullard voice support for raising rates, given that inflation is far above the central bank’s 2% target
body:
Two Federal Reserve officials who spoke Wednesday before congressional testimony by central-bank leader Jerome Powell gave support to a March rate rise.
At the Fed’s policy meeting later this month, “We are going to make an adjustment, we are wrong footed” in terms of how monetary policy stacks up against very high levels of inflation, Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans said in a public appearance.
“We...
